issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

When uploading a chain certificate with the euare-servercertupload command, the chain certificate fails to get uploaded into the cert.pem file on the ELB when launched.  This causes certificate validation issues with ELBs that are using HTTPS/SSL.

*Signs*

* cert.pem file on the ELB should have the following layout:
{code}
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

(--certificate-file argument contents)

-----END CERTIFICATE----- 
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

(--certificate-chain-file argument contents)

-----END CERTIFICATE----- 
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

(--private-key-file argument contents)

-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
{code}
This was not the case for this bug.  '--certificate-chain-file' contents were missing.
* Steps to create HTTPS/SSL ELB:
{code}
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name hasp-euca-elb --certificate-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.cert.pem --private-key-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.key.pem --certificate-chain-file honest-ca-chain-pem.pem --as-account account2 --region admin@

# eulb-create-lb hasp-euca-elb --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/hasp-euca-elb" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
{code}
Once the ELB is running, SSH into the ELB as the cloud administrator, and check out the /var/lib/load-balancer-servo/\{server-certificate-name\}/cert.pem to see if the chain certificate was added.  The only thing that shows up is the file name itself (the file is attached).  Additionally, in the eucalyptus_auth DB, the 'auth_server_cert' shows the file name in the 'metadata_server_cert_chain' column:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# psql -h /var/lib/eucalyptus/db/data -p 8777 eucalyptus_auth
psql (9.1.9)
Type "help" for help.

eucalyptus_auth=# select metadata_server_cert_body,metadata_server_cert_chain from auth_server_cert where metadata_display_name = 'hasp-euca-elb';
                    metadata_server_cert_body                     | metadata_server_cert_chain
------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------
 -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----                                     +| honest-ca-chain-pem.pem
 MIIGRTCCBC2gAwIBAgICEAAwDQYJKoZIhvcNAQELBQAwgaAxCzAJBgNVBAYTAlVT+|
 MRMwEQYDVQQIDApDYWxpZm9ybmlhMRIwEAYDVQQKDAlIb25lc3QgQ0ExKzApBgNV+|
 BAsMIkludGVybWVkaWF0ZSBDZXJ0aWZpY2F0ZSBBdXRob3JpdHkxEjAQBgNVBAMM+|

 Y29tMB4XDTE0MTIxMTIwNTEyMloXDTE1MTIxMTIwNTEyMlowgawxCzAJBgNVBAYT+|
 AlVTMRMwEQYDVQQIDApDYWxpZm9ybmlhMRIwEAYDVQQKDAlIb25lc3QgQ0ExGDAW+|

 ZXYuZXVjYWx5cHR1cy1zeXN0ZW1zLmNvbTEnMCUGCSqGSIb3DQEJARYYaGFyb2xk+|
 LnNwZW5jZXIuanJAaHAuY29tMIICIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAg8AMIICCgKC+|
 AgEAsK4isODKEPFUVXPKmNLL3IY5xUf+vuyxxmS8YuhKN0tfwk3UkPfFyX/BFmTq+|
 v3xFKr98QZDNhdmJFQsRvsfVBaoQ4IYwWtXGf6lkVFc5qFhYqRd9uLyiXSvvd2hQ+|

 -----END CERTIFICATE-----                                       +|
                                                                  |
(1 row)
{code}
* After applying workaround mentioned by customer (putting the chain file in "$\(<honest-ca-chain-pem.pem\)"), the database and the cert.pem file was populated correctly.
{code}
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name hasp-euca-elb-v4 --certificate-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.cert.pem --private-key-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.key.pem --certificate-chain-file "$(<honest-ca-chain-pem.pem)" --as-account account2 --region admin@

# eulb-create-lb hasp-euca-elb --listener "lb-port=80, protocol=http, instance-port=8888, instance-protocol=http" --listener "lb-port=443, protocol=https, instance-port=80, instance-protocol=http, cert-id=arn:aws:iam::325271821652:server-certificate/hasp-euca-elb-v4" --availability-zone Honest --region account2-user11@
{code}
After SSHing into the ELB instance, the cert.pem file contained all the right information (attached).  Additionally, the database contained the correct information:
{code}

                    metadata_server_cert_body                     |                    metadata_server_cert_chain

 w2UzUSTlh5hihYYjJETI7BBrJlp7Uk6XeyppE3EmuZCXLot3APB97vMarcpz/E95+| RFBbp8/NEwE7xoxdlcuS71bHK/2dMiqb8ImCsVDgNy/iFqGBTUbMZbnmdY5z4ik0+
 /eOwshUj/bdd2YCD3b3AyerxuDasMHq+zmDs03zsGAGPtZ1iWeVmTwBXqr6jMTtN+| oBwmfJA+dm1oaWjFxjpaMMr18JkhR5ZwuKEft/lBkOg2FS6x42W+/zoV0pO/aK8W+
 tfSUJjrmh0AP735TQgyadrP3oJ5bTxrk1cCHfD0zVasejr8nrs0gXGsoJuJkMgir+| ePzKV6qOWVlMMI5n0WBNL+xe32KkucrijAcu5UWvuR+kFlI=                +
 TIyc20RABDGCObXJ5xwy/hF8pE+KKEMqAQ==                            +| -----END CERTIFICATE-----
 -----END CERTIFICATE-----                                       +|
                                                                  |
(1 row)
{code}
* Checked out the source code for euare-servercertupload, and saw that in the uploadservercertificate.py file, the ['--certificate-chain' option had a missing variable|https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/blob/master/euca2ools/commands/iam/uploadservercertificate.py#L50-L58].  Provided [the pull request against euca2ools|https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/pull/57].

*Workaround*

Workaround is to pass the contents of the chain certificate file in the '--certificate-chain-file' argument.  For example:

{code}
# euare-servercertupload --server-certificate-name hasp-euca-elb-v2 --certificate-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.cert.pem --private-key-file hasp-euca-elb-pem.key.pem --certificate-chain-file "$(<honest-ca-chain-pem.pem)" --as-account account2 --region admin@
{code}
fields.summary: euare-servercertupload doesn't upload certificate chain files

comments.body: Pull request to fix chain certificate upload issue with euare-servercertupload.

Issue is not present in Euca2ools 3.0.x branch - [uploadservercertifcate.py|https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/blob/3.0-maint/euca2ools/commands/euare/uploadservercertificate.py#L48-L56].  Issue is only present in Euca2ools 3.1.x branch [uploadservercertificate.py|https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/blob/3.1-maint/euca2ools/commands/iam/uploadservercertificate.py#L51-L58] and Euca2ools master branch - [uploadservercertificate.py|https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/blob/master/euca2ools/commands/iam/uploadservercertificate.py#L51-L58].
This is fixed in commit {{5342240}} in mineline euca2ools and commit {{6db29a2}} in the 3.1 maintenance branch.  Thanks for the patch!

Working as designed now:

{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select metadata_display_name,metadata_server_cert_chain,metadata_server_cert_body from eucalyptus_auth.auth_server_cert ;
